Award Type: OTHER REIMBURSABLE, CONTINGENT, INTANGIBLE, OR INDIRECT FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE
Description:
AWARD PURPOSE
THE PURPOSE OF THE JOB CHALLENGE DEMONSTRATION PROJECT ("JOB CHALLENGE PROJECT") IS TO: 1) DETERMINE WHETHER THE JOB CHALLENGE PROGRAM IS A MORE EFFECTIVE MODEL FOR SERVING AT-RISK YOUTH WHEN COMPARED TO THE DEPARTMENT OF LABOR'S TRADITIONAL JOB CORPS PROGRAM MODEL; AND 2) DETERMINE WHETHER THE JOB CHALLENGE PROJECT IS A MORE COST EFFECTIVE MODEL WHEN COMPARED TO THE DEPARTMENT OF LABOR'S TRADITIONAL JOB CORPS PROGRAM MODEL. DOL IS FUNDING THIS DEMONSTRATION PROJECT TO TEST STRATEGIES USED BY THE STATE OF LOUISIANA'S NATIONAL GUARD YOUTH CHALLENGE PROGRAM TO IMPROVE THE WORKFORCE OUTCOMES OF JOB CORPS ELIGIBLE YOUTH.

ACTIVITIES PERFORMED
THE JOB CHALLENGE PROJECT IS A FIVE-MONTH RESIDENTIAL PROGRAM THAT WILL EXPAND AND ENHANCE THE EDUCATION AND JOB TRAINING OF JOB CORPS ELIGIBLE PARTICIPANTS WHO COMPLETE THE FIRST 22-WEEK RESIDENTIAL PHASE OF THE LOUISIANA NATIONAL GUARD YOUTH CHALLENGE PROGRAM AND WHO CHOOSE TO PARTICIPATE IN THE JOB CHALLENGE PROJECT. CADETS IN THE JOB CHALLENGE PROJECT WILL RESIDE AT THE CARVILLE JOB CORPS CENTER SITE AND RECEIVE A ROBUST EDUCATION AND TRAINING EXPERIENCE OVER A 5-MONTH PERIOD, WHILE CONCURRENTLY PARTICIPATING IN THE 12-MONTH MENTORSHIP PHASE OF THE LOUISIANA NATIONAL GUARD YOUTH CHALLENGE. THE JOB CHALLENGE PROJECT EDUCATION AND TRAINING EXPERIENCE WILL PLACE PARTICIPANTS ON A PATHWAY TOWARDS EMPLOYMENT. THE JOB CHALLENGE PROJECT MUST INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING SEVEN (7) ACTIVITIES: 1) RECRUITMENT OF JOB CORPS ELIGIBLE YOUTH FROM THE PARTICIPANTS OF THE FIRST PHASE OF THE YOUTH CHALLENGE PROGRAM; 2) OCCUPATIONAL SKILLS TRAINING AND EDUCATIONAL CREDENTIALING; 3) INDIVIDUALIZED CAREER COUNSELING AND ACADEMIC COUNSELING; 4) WORK-BASED LEARNING AND EXPOSURE TO THE WORLD OF WORK; 5) LEADERSHIP DEVELOPMENT ACTIVITIES THAT ENCOURAGE RESPONSIBILITY, EMPLOYABILITY, AND OTHER POSITIVE SOCIAL BEHAVIORS; 6) EMPLOYER ENGAGEMENT TO ENSURE CADETS' SKILLS ALIGN WITH EMPLOYER NEEDS AT PROGRAM COMPLETION; AND 7) JOB PLACEMENT.

DELIVERABLES
FOR THIS EXPERIMENTAL PROJECT, FOUR OF THE SIX YOUTH PERFORMANCE STANDARDS AT WIOA SECTION 116(B)(2)(A)(II) WILL BE USED TO MEASURE SUCCESS AND ARE AS FOLLOWS:
? THE PERCENTAGE OF PROGRAM PARTICIPANTS WHO ARE IN EDUCATION OR TRAINING ACTIVITIES, OR IN UNSUBSIDIZED EMPLOYMENT, DURING THE SECOND QUARTER AFTER EXIT FROM THE PROGRAM;
? THE PERCENTAGE OF PROGRAM PARTICIPANTS WHO ARE IN EDUCATION OR TRAINING ACTIVITIES, OR IN UNSUBSIDIZED EMPLOYMENT, DURING THE FOURTH QUARTER AFTER EXIT FROM THE PROGRAM;
? THE MEDIAN EARNINGS OF PROGRAM PARTICIPANTS WHO ARE IN UNSUBSIDIZED EMPLOYMENT DURING THE SECOND QUARTER AFTER EXIT FROM THE PROGRAM; AND
? THE PERCENTAGE OF PROGRAM PARTICIPANTS WHO OBTAIN A RECOGNIZED POSTSECONDARY CREDENTIAL, OR A SECONDARY SCHOOL DIPLOMA OR ITS RECOGNIZED EQUIVALENT, DURING PARTICIPATION IN OR WITHIN 1 YEAR AFTER EXIT FROM THE PROGRAM.
IN ADDITION TO THE ABOVE IDENTIFIED WIOA YOUTH PERFORMANCE MEASURES, PERFORMANCE STANDARDS WILL ALSO INCLUDE CRITERIA FOR A QUALIFYING INITIAL PLACEMENT AS WELL AS INITIAL PLACEMENT AVERAGE WAGE OF CADETS WITHIN A TWELVE MONTH WINDOW BEGINNING FROM THE SEPARATION/GRADUATION DATE. THE
DEFINITION OF A QUALIFYING PLACEMENT IS OUTLINED IN JOB CORPS ELECTRONIC POLICY AND REQUIREMENTS HANDBOOK (EPRH) EXHIBIT 4-1 (ATTACHMENT E), AND THE INITIAL PLACEMENT VERIFICATION AND DOCUMENTATION REQUIREMENTS ARE OUTLINED IN JOB CORPS EPRH EXHIBIT 4-2 (ATTACHMENT E).

INTENDED BENEFICIARY
YOUTH WHO MEET ALL OF THE ELIGIBILITY REQUIREMENTS FOR PARTICIPATION IN, AND WHO SUCCESSFULLY COMPLETE THE 22-WEEK RESIDENTIAL PHASE OF THE LOUISIANA NATIONAL GUARD YOUTH CHALLENGE PROGRAM.

SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES
N/A

Award Type: OTHER REIMBURSABLE, CONTINGENT, INTANGIBLE, OR INDIRECT FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE
Description:
AWARD PURPOSE
THE PURPOSE OF THIS STATE OPERATED JOB CORPS DEMONSTRATION PROJECT WITH IDAHO (IDAHO JOBCORPS PROGRAM) IS TO: 1) DETERMINE WHETHER THE IDAHO JOBCORPS PROGRAM IS A MORE EFFECTIVE MODEL FOR SERVING AT-RISK YOUTH AS COMPARED TO THE DEPARTMENT OF LABOR'S (DOL) TRADITIONAL JOB CORPS PROGRAM MODEL; AND 2) AND DETERMINE WHETHER THE IDAHO JOBCORPS PROGRAM IS A MORE COST EFFECTIVE MODEL AS COMPARED TO THE U.S. DEPARTMENT OF LABOR'S TRADITIONAL JOB CORPS PROGRAM MODEL. DOL IS FUNDING THIS DEMONSTRATION PROJECT TO TEST STRATEGIES USED BY THE STATE OF IDAHO TO IMPROVE THE WORKFORCE OUTCOMES OF JOB CORPS ELIGIBLE YOUTH.

ACTIVITIES PERFORMED
FULLY PREPARING JOB CORPS ELIGIBLE OUT-OF-SCHOOL, AT-RISK YOUTH TO ATTAIN A SELF-SUSTAINING CAREER IN ONE OF THE HIGH GROWTH, HIGH DEMAND OCCUPATIONS/INDUSTRIES. THE IDAHO JOBCORPS PROGRAM WILL SERVE BOTH RESIDENTIAL AND NONRESIDENTIAL JOB CORPS ELIGIBLE YOUTH FROM THE STATE OF IDAHO. AS THE GRANTEE, THE IDAHO DEPARTMENT OF LABOR WILL OVERSEE THE IMPLEMENTATION AND MANAGEMENT OF THE IDAHO JOBCORPS PROGRAM AND WILL PROVIDE SOME DIRECT SERVICES. IN ADDITION, THE IDAHO DEPARTMENT OF LABOR WILL DESIGNATE AS SUB-GRANTEES SPECIFIC STATE COMMUNITY COLLEGES TO SERVE AS EDUCATION AND TRAINING PROVIDERS. 

DELIVERABLES
THE IDAHO JOBCORPS PROGRAM WILL SERVE A MINIMUM OF 750 STUDENTS; 600 NON-RESIDENTIAL AND 150 RESIDENTIAL STUDENTS.

INTENDED BENEFICIARY
JOB CORPS ELIGIBLE OUT-OF-SCHOOL, AT RISK YOUTH.

SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES
COLLEGE OF WESTERN IDAHO (CWI) AND OTHER DESIGNATED SUB-GRANTEES WILL PROVIDE EDUCATION AND TRAINING SERVICES TO IDAHO JOBCORPS PROGRAM STUDENTS. IN ADDITION, CWI WILL ALSO PROVIDE SERVICES AND SUPPORT TO RESIDENTIAL STUDENTS. THE IDAHO DEPARTMENT OF LABOR, CWI, AND OTHER DESIGNATED SUB-GRANTEES WILL DELIVER TO THESE JOB CORPS PROGRAM STUDENTS AN INTENSIVE CAREER EXPLORATION PROCESS THAT WILL ASSIST THEM IN THEIR SELECTION OF THE MOST APPROPRIATE CAREER PATHWAY LEADING TO EMPLOYMENT IN A HIGH-GROWTH OCCUPATION.
